NAME

SYNOPSIS

DESCRIPTION

The function terminates a process with the following consequences: All of the descriptors open in the calling process are closed. This may entail delays, for example, waiting for output to drain; a process in this state may not be killed, as it is already dying. If the parent process of the calling process has an outstanding call or catches the signal, it is notified of the calling process’s termination and the is set as defined by The parent process-ID of all of the calling process’s existing child processes are set to 1; the initialization process (see the DEFINITIONS section of inherits each of these processes. If the termination of the process causes any process group to become orphaned (usually because the parents of all members of the group have now exited; see in and if any member of the orphaned group is stopped, the signal and the signal are sent to all members of the newly-orphaned process group. If the process is a controlling process (see the signal is sent to the foreground process group of the controlling terminal, and all current access to the controlling terminal is revoked. Most C programs call the library routine which flushes buffers, closes streams, unlinks temporary files, etc., before calling

RETURN VALUE

can never return.
